intro: Pentanema salicinum, commonly known as the willowleaf pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, willow-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a smooth margin and a soft, silvery-green hue. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are usually white or pale pink and are pollinated by insects.
